ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.

ElementDescription: Sex of subject at birth
Notes: M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: SKIP_SR INTERVIEWER: Skip section SR?
Notes: 1=NO; 5=YES; -8= DK AND REFUSAL

ElementDescription: SR2 Are you currently dating someone exclusively, are you engaged, are you dating several people, or are you not dating?
Notes: 1=Currently dating someone exclusively;2=Engaged;3=Dating several people;4=Not dating; -8= DK AND REFUSAL

ElementDescription: SR3 Num Now I would like to ask a few questions about your current (spouse/partner). How long have you been with your current (spouse/partner)? FIRST ENTER A NUMBER.
Notes: Number; -8= DK AND REFUSAL

ElementDescription: SR3 Unit  How long have you been with your current (spouse/partner)? ENTER THE UNIT
Notes: 1=MONTHS;2=YEARS; -8= DK AND REFUSAL

ElementDescription: SR4 What gender is your (spouse/partner)?
Notes: 1=Male;2=Female; -8= DK AND REFUSAL

ElementDescription: SR5 In what year was (he/she) born? __ __ __ __ YEAR
Notes: YYYY; -8= DK AND REFUSAL

ElementDescription: SR6a How much does your (spouse/partner) make you feel loved and cared for? Would you say a great deal, quite a bit, somewhat, a little, or not at all?
Notes: 1=A GREAT DEAL;2=QUITE A BIT;3=SOMEWHAT;4=A LITTLE;5=NOT AT ALL; -8= DK AND REFUSAL

ElementDescription: SR6b How much do you feel (he/she) makes too many demands on you? (IF NEEDED: Would you say)
Notes: 1=A GREAT DEAL;2=QUITE A BIT;3=SOMEWHAT;4=A LITTLE;5=NOT AT ALL; -8= DK AND REFUSAL

ElementDescription: SR6c How much is (he/she) willing to listen when you need to talk about your worries or problems? (Would you say)
Notes: 1=A GREAT DEAL;2=QUITE A BIT;3=SOMEWHAT;4=A LITTLE;5=NOT AT ALL; -8= DK AND REFUSAL

ElementDescription: SR6d How much is (he/she) critical of you or what you do? (Would you say)
Notes: 1=A GREAT DEAL;2=QUITE A BIT;3=SOMEWHAT;4=A LITTLE;5=NOT AT ALL; -8= DK AND REFUSAL

ElementDescription: SR6e How much can you depend on your (spouse/partner) to be there when you really need (him/her) (Would you say)?
Notes: 1=A GREAT DEAL;2=QUITE A BIT;3=SOMEWHAT;4=A LITTLE;5=NOT AT ALL; -8= DK AND REFUSAL

ElementDescription: SR6f How much tension is there between you and your (spouse/partner)? (Would you say)
Notes: 1=A GREAT DEAL;2=QUITE A BIT;3=SOMEWHAT;4=A LITTLE;5=NOT AT ALL; -8= DK AND REFUSAL

ElementDescription: SR6g How much can you open up to (him/her) about things which are really important to you? (Would you say)
Notes: 1=A GREAT DEAL;2=QUITE A BIT;3=SOMEWHAT;4=A LITTLE;5=NOT AT ALL; -8= DK AND REFUSAL

ElementDescription: SR6h Over the last year, how often did you and your (spouse/partner) have unpleasant disagreements or conflicts?
Notes: 1=A GREAT DEAL;2=QUITE A BIT;3=SOMEWHAT;4=A LITTLE;5=NOT AT ALL; -8= DK AND REFUSAL

ElementDescription: SR7a Think about your (spouses/partners) use of alcohol over the past 6 months. In a TYPICAL week when (he/she) drank any alcohol in the past 6 months, on how many days do you think (he/she) drank alcohol (including beer, malt liquor, wine, liquor, mixed drinks, etc.)?
Notes: Number of Days; -8= DK AND REFUSAL

ElementDescription: SR7b In a TYPICAL week when your (spouse/partner) drank any alcohol in the past 6 months, how many drinks did (he/she) drink on a TYPICAL drinking day? __ __ __ DRINKS
Notes: Number of Drinks; -8= DK AND REFUSAL

ElementDescription: SR7c  HAND CARD AL2. How often do you think your (spouse/partner) got drunk during the last 6 months? By drunk I mean that (his/her) r speech was slurred or (he/she) was unsteady on (his/her) feet?
Notes: 1=Every day;2=5 to 6 days a week;3=4 days a week;4=3 days per week;5=2 days per week;6=1 day per week;7=3 days per month;8=2 days per month;9=1 day per month;10=6 to 11 days;11=3 to 5 days;12=1 to 2 days;13=Never; -8= DK AND REFUSAL

ElementDescription: SR7d How often do you think your (spouse/partner) drank (MALE: 5 or more drinks/FEMALE: 4 or more drinks) in a 24 hour period during the last 6 months? USE CARD AL2.
Notes: 1=Every day;2=5 to 6 days a week;3=4 days a week;4=3 days per week;5=2 days per week;6=1 day per week;7=3 days per month;8=2 days per month;9=1 day per month;10=6 to 11 days;11=3 to 5 days;12=1 to 2 days;13=Never; -8= DK AND REFUSAL

ElementDescription: SR7e How often do you think your (spouse/partner) smoked cigarettes or used other tobacco products (hookah, e-cigarettes, cigarillos, cigars, etc.) during the last 6 months? USE CARD AL2.
Notes: 1=Every day;2=5 to 6 days a week;3=4 days a week;4=3 days per week;5=2 days per week;6=1 day per week;7=3 days per month;8=2 days per month;9=1 day per month;10=6 to 11 days;11=3 to 5 days;12=1 to 2 days;13=Never; -8= DK AND REFUSAL

ElementDescription: SR7e1 How many cigarettes do you think your (spouse/partner) typically smoked on days (he/she) smoked during the last 6 months? IF DIDN T SMOKE CIGARETTES, ENTER A ZERO
Notes: Number of Cigarettes; -8= DK AND REFUSAL

ElementDescription: SR7f How often do you think your (spouse/partner) used marijuana during the last 6 months? USE CARD AL2.
Notes: 1=Every day;2=5 to 6 days a week;3=4 days a week;4=3 days per week;5=2 days per week;6=1 day per week;7=3 days per month;8=2 days per month;9=1 day per month;10=6 to 11 days;11=3 to 5 days;12=1 to 2 days;13=Never; -8= DK AND REFUSAL

ElementDescription: SR7g How often do you think your (spouse/partner) used other drugs (like cocaine, uppers, or any of the other drugs we have talked about) during the last 6 months? USE CARD AL2.
Notes: 1=Every day;2=5 to 6 days a week;3=4 days a week;4=3 days per week;5=2 days per week;6=1 day per week;7=3 days per month;8=2 days per month;9=1 day per month;10=6 to 11 days;11=3 to 5 days;12=1 to 2 days;13=Never; -8= DK AND REFUSAL

ElementDescription: SR8 Now I would like to ask a few questions about your best friends behavior in the last 6 months. READ ONLY IF R IS IN RELATIONSHIP: Please think about best friends other than your romantic partner. DOES R VOLUNTEER THAT SHE/HE HAS NO BEST FRIENDS?
Notes: 1=NO; 5=YES; -8= DK AND REFUSAL

ElementDescription: SR8a In the last 6 months... How many of your best friends smoked cigarettes or used other tobacco products (like e-cigarettes, hookah, etc) regularly? By regularly I mean more days than not. Would you say none of them, a few of them, most of them, or all of them?
Notes: 1=A GREAT DEAL;2=QUITE A BIT;3=SOMEWHAT;4=A LITTLE;5=NOT AT ALL; -8= DK AND REFUSAL

ElementDescription: SR8b In the last 6 months... How many of your best friends got drunk regularly? By regularly I mean once a week or more. [ If needed: by drunk I mean that their speech was slurred or they were unsteady on their feet.] Would you say none of them, a few of them, most of them, or all of them?
Notes: 1=A GREAT DEAL;2=QUITE A BIT;3=SOMEWHAT;4=A LITTLE;5=NOT AT ALL; -8= DK AND REFUSAL

ElementDescription: SR8b1 In the last 6 months... Focusing on your best friend other than your spouse, what would you consider to be his or her drinking status?
Notes: 5=HEAVY DRINKER;4=MODERATE DRINKER;3=LIGHT DRINKER;2=DOES NOT DRINK;1=RECOVERING ALCOHOLIC; -8= DK AND REFUSAL

ElementDescription: SR8b2 In the last 6 months... To the best of your knowledge, how often did your best friend drink alcohol?
Notes: 7=DAILY;6=3 to 6Xs per WK;5=1 to 2Xs per WK;4=EVERY OTHER WEEK;3=ABOUT 1 per MONTH;2= LESS THAN MONTHLY;1=ONCE;0=NOT AT ALL; -8= DK AND REFUSAL

ElementDescription: SR8b3 In the last 6 months... To the best of your knowledge, what is the most drinks he or she consumed in a day?
Notes: 4=10 (or more) DRINKS;3=6 to 9 DRINKS;2=3 to 5 DRINKS;1=1 to 2 DRINKS;0=DOES NOT DRINK

ElementDescription: SR8c In the last 6 months... How many of your male best friends drank 5 or more drinks in a 24 hour period? (Would you say none, a few, most or all of them?)
Notes: 1=NONE OF THEM;2=A FEW OF THEM;3=MOST OF THEM;4=ALL OF THEM; 5=NO MALE BEST FRIENDS;-8= DK AND REFUSAL

ElementDescription: SR8d In the last 6 months... How many of your female best friends drank 4 or more drinks in a 24 hour period? (Would you say none, a few, most or all of them?)
Notes: 1=NONE OF THEM;2=A FEW OF THEM;3=MOST OF THEM;4=ALL OF THEM;5=NO FEMALE BEST FRIENDS; -8= DK AND REFUSAL

ElementDescription: SR8e In the last 6 months... How many of your best friends used marijuana regularly? By regularly I mean once a week or more. (Would you say none, a few, most or all of them?)
Notes: 1=NONE OF THEM;2=A FEW OF THEM;3=MOST OF THEM;4=ALL OF THEM; -8= DK AND REFUSAL

ElementDescription: SR8f In the last 6 months... How many of your best friends used other drugs (like cocaine, uppers, or any of the other drugs we have talked about)? (Would you say none, a few, most or all of them?)
Notes: 1=NONE OF THEM;2=A FEW OF THEM;3=MOST OF THEM;4=ALL OF THEM; -8= DK AND REFUSAL

ElementDescription: SR9 Now I would like to ask a few questions about your peer group more broadly than just best friends. Please think about the people from your school, work, as well as those from recreational sports teams, church groups, or other groups you are a part of. We would like to know how often these people used various substances in the last 6 months, not necessarily when you see them, but maybe in their free time.
Notes: 1=NO; 5=YES; -8= DK AND REFUSAL

ElementDescription: SR9a In the last 6 months... How many of these people smoked cigarettes or used other tobacco products (like e-cigarettes, hookah, etc) regularly? By regularly I mean more days than not. Would you say none of them, a few of them, most of them, or all of them?
Notes: 1=NONE OF THEM;2=A FEW OF THEM;3=MOST OF THEM;4=ALL OF THEM; -8= DK AND REFUSAL

ElementDescription: SR9b In the last 6 months... How many of these people got drunk regularly? By regularly I mean once a week or more. [If needed: by drunk I mean that their speech was slurred or they were unsteady on their feet.] (Would you say none, a few, most or all of them?)
Notes: 1=NONE OF THEM;2=A FEW OF THEM;3=MOST OF THEM;4=ALL OF THEM; -8= DK AND REFUSAL

ElementDescription: SR9c In the last 6 months... How many of these men drank 5 or more drinks in a 24 hour period? (Would you say none, a few, most or all of them?)
Notes: 1=NONE OF THEM;2=A FEW OF THEM;3=MOST OF THEM;4=ALL OF THEM; -8= DK AND REFUSAL

ElementDescription: SR9d In the last 6 months... How many of these women drank 4 or more drinks in a 24 hour period? (Would you say none, a few, most or all of them?)
Notes: 1=NONE OF THEM;2=A FEW OF THEM;3=MOST OF THEM;4=ALL OF THEM; -8= DK AND REFUSAL

ElementDescription: SR9e In the last 6 months... How many of these people used marijuana regularly? By regularly I mean once a week or more. (Would you say none, a few, most or all of them?)
Notes: 1=NONE OF THEM;2=A FEW OF THEM;3=MOST OF THEM;4=ALL OF THEM; -8= DK AND REFUSAL

ElementDescription: SR9f In the last 6 months... How many of these people used other drugs (like cocaine, uppers, or any of the other drugs we ve talked about)? (Would you say none, a few, most or all of them?)
Notes: 1=NONE OF THEM;2=A FEW OF THEM;3=MOST OF THEM;4=ALL OF THEM; -8= DK AND REFUSAL

ElementDescription:
SR10a Now I'd like to ask you some questions about whether anyone in your immediate family has a history of alcoholism or problem drinking. By this I mean a person who has physical or emotional problems because of drinking; problems with a spouse, partner, family or friends because of drinking; problems at work or school because of drinking, problems because of driving after drinking, or a person who seems to spend a lot of time drinking or being hung over.

Did your biological father have a history of alcoholism or problem drinking?
Notes: 1=NO; 5=YES; -8= DK AND REFUSAL

ElementDescription: SR10b How about your biological mother?
Notes: 1=NO; 5=YES; -8= DK AND REFUSAL

ElementDescription: SR10c How many full brothers do you have? By that I mean brothers who have the same mother and father as you.
Notes: Number; -8= DK AND REFUSAL

ElementDescription: SR10c1 (Does your brother/do any of your brothers) have a history of alcoholism or problem drinking?
Notes: 1=NO; 5=YES; -8= DK AND REFUSAL

ElementDescription: SR10d How many full sisters do you have? By that I mean sisters who have the same mother and father as you.
Notes: Number; -8= DK AND REFUSAL

ElementDescription: SR10d1 (Does your sister/do any of your sisters) have a history of alcoholism or problem drinking?
Notes: 1=NO; 5=YES; -8= DK AND REFUSAL

ElementDescription: SR10d2 How many biological sons do you have?
Notes: Number; -8= DK AND REFUSAL

ElementDescription: SR10d3 (Does your son/do any of your sons) have a history of alcoholism or problem drinking?
Notes: 1=NO; 5=YES; -8= DK AND REFUSAL

ElementDescription: SR10d4 How many biological daughters do you have?
Notes: Number; -8= DK AND REFUSAL

ElementDescription: SR10d5 (Does your daughter/do any of your daughters) have a history of alcoholism or problem drinking?
Notes: 1=NO; 5=YES; -8= DK AND REFUSAL

ElementDescription: SR10e What about your (spouse/partner)? Does (he/she) have a history of alcoholism or problem drinking?
Notes: 1=NO; 5=YES; -8= DK AND REFUSAL

ElementDescription: SR11a Did your biological father ever have any problems with drugs at any time in his life?
Notes: 1=NO; 5=YES; -8= DK AND REFUSAL

ElementDescription: SR11b How about your biological mother?
Notes: 1=NO; 5=YES; -8= DK AND REFUSAL

ElementDescription: SR11c How about your brother(s)?
Notes: 1=NO; 5=YES; -8= DK AND REFUSAL

ElementDescription: SR11d How about your sister(s)?
Notes: 1=NO; 5=YES; -8= DK AND REFUSAL

ElementDescription: SR11d1 How about your son(s)?
Notes: 1=NO; 5=YES; -8= DK AND REFUSAL

ElementDescription: SR11d2 How about your daughter(s)?
Notes: 1=NO; 5=YES; -8= DK AND REFUSAL

ElementDescription: SR11e What about your (spouse/partner)? Has (he/she) ever had any problems with drugs at any time in His/Her life?
Notes: 1=NO; 5=YES; -8= DK AND REFUSAL
